entry.title: Rome's Demise: A Personal Conflict
entry.summary: Rome fell by coincidence, timing left the armies of Rome in the hands of two young emperors: ages 10 and 18, each controlled by a different minister. The two ministers hated eachother The Goths had settled too close to Romans before, and the emperors in…
entry.content:
Rome fell by coincidence, timing left the armies of Rome in the hands of two young emperors: ages 10 and 18, each controlled by a different minister. The two ministers hated eachother

The Goths had settled too close to Romans before, and the emperors in charge have commanded their armies
